title: Quest "Return to Kheyna" seemingly has wrong quest starter
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
The quest "Return to Kheyna" really really seems like it should be given by Reas, not by Kheyna, for several reasons:
 - The quest text says _"I will deal with these as instructed. You better go back to whoever sent you."_ Which makes sense if said by Reas ("these", referring to the brains you just gave her), but makes no sense if said by Kheyna (she is the one that sent you).
 - It leaves you with no indication of what you have to do afterwards. You need to use the crystal to summon Kheyna and get the quest, then you then need to wait for her to despawn and use the crystal again, which is very unintuitive.
 - It's extremely easy to miss the rest of the quest chain in its current form, since you just give the brains to Reas and there's no followup and no indication of where to go.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**
Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=80409

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
It should be started by https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=51266 as per the previous step: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=80408

Classic is different from Vanilla as it uses a modified game engine, so not all abilities work the same way as they used to work in 2004-2006.

The easy solution is to disable auto casting for Dash.

The AI for pets is very primitive: if you have both Bite and Claw on auto-cast, Bite will be used once and then the pet will dump all focus into Claw, so you have to babysit your pet for maximum efficiency.
This is correct, you have to disable auto-cast for your pet's abilities :)

I just want to point something out: this quest **is not broken**.  The problem lies in the quest order.

Completing the quest "[The Perfect Stout](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=315)" automatically unlocks "Shimmer Stout" if the player is Level 8 or higher.  Accepting "Shimmer Stout" automatically nullifies "Rejold's New Brew".

Presently, if players want to do both quests, they need to _ignore_ "Shimmer Stout", then go talk to [Tharek Blackstone](https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=1872) in Kharanos.  They can grab "Rejold's New Brew" and be funneled back toward Rejold, then.

It's also worth mentioning that Pilot Bellowfiz was never intended to give out this quest.  This is simply an error in the _Turtle WoW_ pfQuest database module.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6526157/172518503-88c31856-bd07-4161-8b4a-47a659cb9f55.mp4

I target the Marksman and use Whirlwind. Scout dodges. I am unable to use Overpower on the Scout.

Can confirm this still happens on current version. While spells such as Cleave or any attacks from Sweeping Strikes will allow you to target the Dodging enemy and use Overpower, Whirlwind Dodges will simply not highlight (or "activate") Overpower.

Believe it or not, the main difference of whirlwind is that it's considered an AoE spell that deals weapon damage, except it's specifically hardcapped to 4 targets. This may sound obvious at first, but the other abilities such as cleave and sweeping strikes use different spell effects on a fundamental level that generate "targeted attacks". Even though whirlwind can be dodged, the system never registers a specific target or targets for the spell, and thus overpower is unable to register a target for itself. This cannot be fixed without fundamentally changing how whirlwind functions.
I'm fairly sure it didn't work like that in Classic, but I don't have any evidence for that at the moment.

title: Orgrimmar -> Kargath Zeppelin kills people via fall damage
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
This is a pretty common problem but I couldn't find an open issue about it.
When you take the zeppelin from Orgrimmar to Kargath, you have a very good chance of instantly dying from fall damage.
In fact, the zeppelin is rather infamous for this. If you go to Kargath you will almost certainly see floating corpses and skeletons.

Worldchat has said the following about this bug:
- It does not happen when going from Kargath to Orgrimmar, only from Orgrimmar to Kargath.
- Apparently, if your loading screens are *very* fast, you don't die from it. This might depend on your connection to the server, your PC, or both.
- If it happens to you, it will happen to you pretty much 100% of the time. If it doesn't happen to you, it will probably never happen to you. Further crediting the idea that it depends on your connection to the server, your PC, or both.
- One guy said the devs tried to fix it by adding a grace period where you are immune to fall damage after teleporting from a zep, but the fall damage is "stored" until after your game finishes loading, so you die if your loading screen is longer than the grace period.
- One guy said alttabbing during the loading screen makes him fall through boats, further crediting the idea that strange things during loading screens is the cause for these problems.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Take the zeppelin from Orgrimmar to Kargath.

3. death

title: Warlock Summoned Mob Duration (Doomguard)
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
This is identical to the newly posted bug for the Infernal by myself. Currently on the server, if a Doomguard is summoned it will remain spawned for a default 30 minutes. This is incorrect from old 2004-2006 retail WoW behavior, and is a very old Mang0s core bug located on the previous Valkyrie, VanillaWoW, Feenix, Kronos, and Nostalrius servers.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
Summon a Doomguard with a Warlock using either the Curse of Doom or the Ritual of Doom spells.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**
TurtleWoW Spell Link (Curse of Doom) -- https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=603
TurtleWoW Spell Link (Ritual of Doom) -- https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=18540
TurtleWoW Mob Link (Doomguard) -- https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=11859

WoWHead Classic Spell Link (Curse of Doom) -- https://classic.wowhead.com/spell=603/curse-of-doom
WoWHead Classic Spell Link (Ritual of Doom) -- https://classic.wowhead.com/spell=18540/ritual-of-doom
WoWHead Classic Mob Link (Doomguard) -- https://classic.wowhead.com/npc=11859/doomguard

Vintage Youtube Doomguard behavior Link -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SagtQmamJ9A

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
This is nearly identical to how the summoned Infernal script is supposed to work, but with one change. When a Doomguard is summoned by means of the Curse of Doom spell, it will pick up a hate list of enemy targets within its normal detection range and remain spawned as long as his hate list has something on it. The Doomguard can be kited, the same as the infernal, which can increase targets on the hate list. Once the Doomguard's hate list is empty, it despawns within 10 seconds of it remaining clear.

The Ritual of Doom means of summoning it is slightly different. The Doomguard gains the casting Warlock as its initial hate list target automatically the moment it spawns. The amount of hate the Doomguard has for the Warlock is extremely weak - a lvl 1 healing spell or a buff cast on the Warlock from another player will put the 2nd player higher on the hate list every time. It follows the exact same behavior for despawning when its hate list is clear within 10 seconds.

comments.body: Fixed in next update.

title: Warlock Spell Inferno (Mob: Infernal duration)
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Currently on the server, if an Infernal is summoned by the Warlock spell, Inferno, it will remain spawned for a duration of 30 minutes. This is a very old Mang0s core bug plaguing private servers since 2012 at least, inclusive of Valkyrie, Feenix, Kronos, & Nostalrius WoW. It's sadly abused by players to create lethal situations in quest hubs for the lulz.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
Cast the spell and then confirm the Infernal Mob will hang around for the extended duration.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

Turtle WoW Warlock Spell Link (Inferno) -- https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=1122
Turtle WoW summoned Mob Link -- https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=89

Classic WoWHead spell link -- https://classic.wowhead.com/spell=1122/inferno
Classic WoWhead summoned Mob Link -- https://classic.wowhead.com/npc=89/infernal

Vintage Youtube Link from 2006 era retail (infernal) -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zWGKVPQ2LZ8
Vintage Youtube Link from 2006 era retail (Doomguard) -- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SagtQmamJ9A

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
How it should work - The Inferno Spell will summon the Infernal Mob which will gain a hate list of enemy flagged mobs and players within its normal radius for detection. The mob will remain spawned for as long as the hate list contains targets. Note that healing or buffing a player or mob adds targets to the hate list as usual.

Once the hate list is empty, the mob will despawn on its own within a 10 second time frame and the hate list continues to be empty. Note that this hate list mechanic for keeping the mob spawned is identical to the mechanic used for the old 2004-2006 retail Doomguard summon, either from Ritual of Doom or Curse of Doom.

" When Enslave breaks, the only person that's on the Infernal's agro list is you. If it kills you, then its agro list is empty and it despawns. But what normally happens is that someone else hits the Infernal, or heals you, or does something else to end up on its list - which means that the Infernal won't despawn until that person is dead. "

http://wowmb.net/forums/f9/2827-infernal_doomguard_discussion/p2/

The formula for attack speed is :

Weapon atk speed / (1+ % of bonus)

So for a 3,5 weapon :

3,5 / (1+0,3) = 2,69

Your formula was : weapon atk speed*(1-% of bonus) 
but it's wrong because if you have 100% of bonus you would get infinite speed,instead of 200%

https://classic-wow-archive.fandom.com/wiki/Attack_speed

This is the same formula that is used on classic. Haste sources are multiplicative. Closing this issue as solved.

title: Roleplay Suggestion - Harlus Ashbuckle (Quest: Hawk's Vigil)
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

**!!! WARNING SPOILERS AHEAD TO THE QUESTLINE OF INVESTIGATING HAWK'S VIGIL. DO NOT READ FURTHER IF YOU MIND SPOILERS !!!**

Not a bug report this time but a suggestion. I will try to make my case (or our case really).

To be brief, my team and I noticed something when we tried to run the "Hawk's Vigil" quest. Its not a bug at all! The quest works. However ...

We realize that "roleplay is encouraged but not enforced" on the server as per the rules outlined on the forum. We are not complete strangers to the concept of roleplay so we try to view things both from an **in-character** perspective but also an **out-of-character** perspective when we play on the server.

(Context for those who do not know: In-character (IC) means "Everything your character knows" where as Out-of-character (OOC) means "Everything you as player knows. Naturally OOC knowledge encompasses IC knowledge (since you as player know everything you do but also everything your character knows) but IC knowledge does not encompass OOC knowledge. Your character doesn't generally know what you as player know. (except if you play a human woman and make fourth wall jokes as it were...)

Anyways, with that out of the way ... the OOC knowledge of the quest leading to "Hawk's Vigil" (the fight against Harlus Ashbuckle) is abundantly clear. The quest clearly ties in with the "corrupt nobles" storyline that the alliance player has the pleasure of playing through.

However, when it comes to the IC (in-character) knowledge of the character being sent to **execute** Harlus Ashbuckle (aka. Martin Corinth) the IC (In-character) knowledge of the player is little more than hear-say and suspicions as the player actually lacks any direct evidence of dark arts being practiced.

**Why is this an important roleplay problem?**

IC (in-character) the npc Harlus Ashbuckle (Martin Corinth) had already been sentenced to execution but **was pardoned** and the sentence overturned into an exile **on the stipulation that the npc stops practicing dark arts**. However from an OOC perspective, the questline is abundantly clear about the npc being the "villain of the story" and very much the "practitioner of dark arts" he was sentenced for.

**So where is the problem then?**

_The problem is that the IC character does not have the OOC knowledge or direct evidence for that npc practicing dark arts - while they stand before the npc telling them they are to be executed for something that there does not seem to be direct IC (in-character) evidence for._


**So then, what do you propose to change and resolve that problem?**

My team and I were thinking ... probably the path of least resistance since everything works great otherwise! We would propose the following change to two quest-texts:

This is what the player has as conversation option to click when they right click the npc after accepting the Hawk's Vigil" quest to fight against Harlus Ashbuckle.
"Martin Corinth, you are to be executed for crimes against the alliance"
-> changed to ->
"Martin Corinth, you are under suspicion of violating the stipulation of your pardon and suspected of practicing dark arts within alliance territory."

And the other change we would propose is the scripted response of the npc after the player selects the above conversation option:
"Executed?!"
-> changed to ->
"Oh, so you found me out. I thought that might happen eventually but if you are as smart as to come this far you must know that I cannot afford to leave any witnesses."

Another thing we had to look up on the database (which is an out-of-character action) is that the npc seems to have shadow resistance. We wanted to propose to remove that resistance and, instead, giving him the warlock armor spell to periodically cast as an IC (in-character) action (every half hour or whenever that spell needs to be renewed). That would add a layer of  detective work for players to get an indication of dark arts being practiced. granted they would need the "detect magic spell" or to observe the npc when the spell is cast but we feel that would make an excellent addition so we wanted to propose it.


We realize that these are only very minor changes and actual game-performance is not affected but we feel it would serve the questline and **enhance the roleplay around it** that tries to portray a villain and practitioner of dark arts to make it more obvious at the very end and unveil the villain for the "practitioner of dark arts" he is meant to be.

Finally we would like to say that we feel that this questline was very lovingly crafted and convey and show our respect for all the work that went into that quest and conceptualizing, writing and building it as it is. It takes a lot of effort and knowledge to create, conceptualize and then tie-in a quest of such depth within and into an already existing framework.

Thank you for your attention and for reading our case. 

Naturally, if everything, even the texts discussed here, is as intended, please do not mind our suggestion, we mean to help ... not infringe upon creative works.

Alright people, let's keep the discussion on topic. Let us not be diverted by apparent viability of other classes' specs, or future plans of incoming class changes. They are topics of their own and are separate from what we are trying to determine here. Namely, whether or not this is working as intended.

Normally, the Warlock class was presented with choosing between Demonic Sacrifice and Shadow Mastery if one is going for a build utilizing Ruin (Destruction), arguably one of the most important talents a Warlock could have. Sure, you could take both Shadow Mastery and Demonic Sacrifice as part of your build, but you would not be able to take Ruin. That is an important distinction. If you want to benefit from all 3, not only would you have to pay the fee of 50g for respeccing, you also have to be near a talent retrainer, and would only be able to do so in a 30-minute environment (the duration of the buff Touch of Shadow). This makes it impractical to use in a raid setting as you would have to go back to a talent retrainer each time and pay 100g every 30 minutes.

The accessibility of a Goblin Brainwashing Device changes all that.

In conjunction, I have inquired exhaustively whether other talents that can provide active buffs behave similarly, and it seems other classes do not benefit from the same convenience. To illustrate:

**Druid** - Omen of Clarity (Balance) is an active buff that can be placed on the Druid. Once a Druid respecs out of it, the buff is lost. This means that if a Druid wants the benefits of Omen of Clarity, they must always have that talent.

**Hunter** - similarly, Trueshot Aura (Marksmanship) buff is lost on the Hunter and the entire party upon respeccing.

**Mage** - Combustion (Fire) buff is lost on respeccing.

**Priest** - this is a strange one. When a Priest buffs a party with Divine Spirit (Holy), the other members of the party retain the buff but the Priest himself/herself loses it upon respeccing.

**Paladin** - I have not yet thoroughly determined what the effects are on Blessing of Kings (Protection).

This is not to argue against Goblin Brainwashing Devices and its use. This is to argue that to stay in line with other classes, Touch of Shadow must be removed from the active buffs on a Warlock if they do not have the talent Demonic Sacrifice as part of their build.

> **Paladin** - I have not yet thoroughly determined what the effects are on Blessing of Kings (Protection).

You can spec for an improved aura and respec and still keep the benefit of the aura, until you take it off. But this is hardly useful, unless you want to hyper optimize gold farming.

title: Warlocks having Touch of Shadow buff even when Demonic Sacrifice is absent from their current talent build
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:** 
The Warlock class can exploit the Goblin Brainwashing Device by double dipping in the talents Demonic Sacrifice (Demonology) and Shadow Mastery (Affliction). Warlocks can retain the buff Touch of Shadow by speccing first into Demonic Sacrfice, sacrificing a Succubus pet, and then later speccing into a talent build where Demonic Sacrifice is absent (e.g., SM/Ruin). This increases their damage dealt by a total of +25% Shadow Damage for 30 minutes on top of other talent build benefits, and can be repeated whenever or wherever a Goblin Brainwashing Device can be used.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Spec into Demonic Sacrifice (Demonology)
2. Summon a Succubus pet
3. Sacrifice the Succubus pet using Demonic Sacrifice
4. Gain the buff Touch of Shadow (Shadow damage is increased by 15%)
4. Use a Goblin Brainwashing Device to respec to a build with 5/5 Shadow Mastery (Affliction) but without Demonic Sacrifice (e.g., SM/Ruin)
5. Retain the buff Touch of Shadow (+15% Shadow Damage) and have Shadow Mastery (+10% Shadow Damage) active, thereby providing a total of +25% increased Shadow Damage for 30 minutes (or until dying)
6. If the buff Touch of Shadow falls out (either through dying or 30 minutes of gameplay occured), repeat the process

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

If a Warlock doesn't have Demonic Sacrifice as part of their active spec, the buff Touch of Shadow should be removed from the active buffs on the Warlock.

title: NPC: Marsh Inkspewer (Ability Cooldown)
body:
The Marsh Inkspewer in Swamp of Sorrows currently has a 6 to 8 second cooldown on its Inkspray ability, giving the player a 50% melee hit miss chance for 15 seconds, leaving this ability with a 100% uptime during a combat with one.

TurtleWoW NPC Mob Link -- https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=750
TurtleWoW NPC Ability Link -- https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=9612

WoWHead Classic Mob Link -- https://classic.wowhead.com/npc=750/marsh-inkspewer#drops
WoWHead Classic Ability Link -- https://classic.wowhead.com/spell=9612/ink-spray

TurtleWoW In Game Image -- https://postimg.cc/Yvw0mCcT

Observation -- the old 2004/2005 retail version of this mob would have a cast time of 1 second on the ability (giving a quick player a chance to interrupt) while also having a very, very short combat range that it could cast it on a player. In the old days you'd fight one as a bear druid or a warrior, wait to hear / see its casting animation, and IMMEDIATELY side strafe / jump to the side so that when the cast would conclude, the target (player) was out of the combat range of the spell and it would fail.

This Mang0s build of the mob and ability is giving it a much greater casting range to target (cannot do the classic dodge to fail the cast), and also has the mob recast within its 15 second duration (with no diminishing returns) for 100% of the fight. This is kind of OP and not in line with the old game.

Suggestion -- Restrict the range of the cast spell closer to the classic combat range (TurtleWoW's Silithid Invader / Silithid Pox abilities match how the Inkspray Should be working) or give the ability a cooldown that is greater than its duration by 4 or 5 seconds.

Silithid Invader Reference TurtleWoW Link -- https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=4131#drop

The "Highborne Wraith" in the quest "The Lost Tablets" spawns but does not attack the player even though it is hostile. Is this intended? My friends and I kinda liked that the wraith did not attack but it does present an issue: How does the player obtain the ancient thalasian tablet if they choose not to attack the wraith which does not attack either?

title: Blackfathom Depths - Shadowmage Mindcontrol Bug
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
In the dungeon "Blackfathom Depths" near the end you can find Twilight Shadow mages who will often try to mind control player characters. By default, the player should be able to counterspell the attempt to mind control a player provided they notice and counterspell in time. However, testing has showed that the casting of mind control by twilight shadow mages can -NOT- be counter spelled even if the mage catches it in time. The counter spell will hit but the mind control will finish casting and either get resisted by the player or hit the player who is then mind controlled until the enemy shadow mage is defeated

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Enter Blackfathom Depths and proceed to where Twilight shadow mages can be found to initiate combat with one
2. Attempt to counter spell the mind control spell they cast on one of the players
3. Note how the counter spell -does- hit but the mind control finishes casting anyways

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=4813

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
The counter spell should interrupt the mind control spell and forbid casting shadow magic for ten seconds, or however long counter spell forbids casting the same magic that was counter spelled.

title: Level requirements for weapon training (except polearms) did not exist in Vanilla
body:
On current Turtle WoW, weapon training requires level 5, but on Vanilla, it only required level one as can be seen here:

https://wowpedia.fandom.com/wiki/Weapon_master?type=revision&diff=22127&oldid=5295

This edit is from Vanilla-time and has not been challenged, and in addition to that, while polearms are clearly mentioned as requiring a certain level in the WoWhead comments of the era, none do for other weapon skills; I think this is sufficient evidence to say those requirements did not exist.

title: Resistances in AQ are too high
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
All mobs and bosses have a flat resistance of 75 to all schools of magic in AQ40. In AQ20 there are even higher resistances, bosses and mobs range from 115-155 (ossirian excluded). The resistance in classic seems to be roughly 30, see below.
**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**
To check the average damage mitigation casters get in classic I looked at elemental shamans, since no curse helps them with nature resistance. I exluded anyone with spellpen gear and only looked at boss encounters so the level-based resistance would be at a flat 24 resistance and 6% average damage mitigation from it. Thunderfury debuff was too prevalent to be excluded, but the shamans without this debuff showed no exception. That is a bit odd since the resistances doesnt seem to be 0, but it could just be a small sample.

title: Quest Issue - Lucky Coin - Numerous spelling errors.
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

The quest, Lucky Coin, available near Northshire Abbey, features some pretty terrible spelling, to the point where the objective of the quest is a little hard to understand. Examples of the spelling issues:
"Toss a coin with a wish for my short by return to Stormwind for good?"
"...I have a request for you. Hah, I've said that!" 
"I could possibly ask for one thing I desire to do...." 



**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Start a new character
2. Walk up to the quest giver (Teresa)
3. Read the quest

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**


Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=60050


**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

Grammatically the quest log needs a tune up in several ways. The quest says "Drop a coin to *the* trade district fountain", when it should be drop a coin *in* the trade district fountain. "Hah, i've said that!" should be "Hah, i've said it!" or "Hah, I finally said it!". "I'm so nervous to pick on people leaving the Abbey" should be "It makes me so nervous to approach people leaving the abbey". "But for me, it's the only way I could possibly ask for one thing I desire to do" should be  "But it's the only way I can possibly get my wish fulfilled".

In the next paragraph, "You see, I love to visit Stormwind from time to time when I'm on my trade trip to the Gallina Winery" should be "You see, I love visiting Stormwind when I go to trade at Gallina Winery". "I always walk by the Trade District Fountain which stands right next to the Bank" should be "I always walk past the trade district fountain, which is right next to the bank". 

The third paragraph is a bit of a mess and needs a complete rewriting. I propose "Could you toss a coin of mine into the fountain for good luck? I've heard that if you drop a coin into the fountain, your wish might get granted, and my wish is to visit Stormwind again as soon as possible!"

Those are my suggested alterations anyways.

title: Deepmoss Webspinner (Broken ability cooldown)
body:
The Deepmoss Webspinner NPC mob located in Stonetalon will currently use its Web root effect on a player that has a duration of 9 seconds, and immediately root the player in succession every 8 seconds while a combat continues. There are no diminishing returns applied on the Web effect - it retains its full 9 second duration each time. There is no appreciable cooldown to its ability with it being set at 8 seconds. The mob will just spam it eternally with full effect.

This behavior is incorrect. While I am not certain that its documented that this Web effect should have diminishing returns, it absolutely should have the standard 6 second cooldown between uses of this ability or greater.

title: FPS issue in Sparkwater Port (Durotar)
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

Sparkwater port is a very nice and detailed addition to the game, but maybe a little bit too detailed.
Indeed when you go in this village playing on a low-end machine, you FPS is going to drop significantly.
This is a matter of DrawCalls. Since the Vanilla WoW engine works with frustrum culling, everything in your field of view is being calculated by your CPU and GPU.
The more objects, the more calculation, the less FPS on older machines.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Login to TW with a potatoe laptop and go to Sparwater Port. Then enjoy your bellow to 30 fps.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

The FPS in Sparwater Port should match the FPS in other Azeroth village witch are close in size, such as Booty Bay for instance.
Please consider removing some useless objects from Sparkwater Port, give some love to the people playing on low-end pc/laptop :-)

title: [Priest] Spirit Tap causing PERMANENT Spirit loss
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

The talent Spirit Tap from Priest can cause a PERMANENT Spirit loss. I found this out when I was leveling in the Wetlands: the Mosshide Fenrunners and Mosshide Gnolls can apply a disease called Spirit Decay, which decreases your Spirit attribute by 6. Spirit Tap temporarily doubles your Spirit after killing an enemy, however because of the way it is coded it appears to temporarily double any Spirit debuffs you have as well (aka it doubles your TOTAL Spirit, including any Spirit debuffs). In this case, if you are afflicted by Spirit Decay it will double the Spirit loss from -6 to -12. The problem comes when trying to cast Cure Disease on yourself when Spirit Tap and Spirit Decay are both active: Cure Disease will remove the -6 Spirit debuff from the Spirit Decay, however the rest of -6 Spirit will remain even after the debuff has been removed, going down to a PERMANENT -3 Spirit after Spirit Tap expires. This can lead to some unfortunate permanent Spirit loss (I'm currently at -6 Spirit because I've done it twice) that cannot be recovered by any means as far as I'm aware. A similar behavior can be expected if the Spirit Decay debuff naturally expires before Spirit Tap does while both are active.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Play Priest and have 5/5 points in Spirit Tap.  Make sure that you have the Cure Disease spell trained as well.
2. Fight a Mosshide Fenrunner or Mosshide Gnoll and let him cast Spirit Decay on you.
3. When you kill him and Spirit Tap procs, check your attributes. You should have -12 Spirit instead of -6.
4. Cast Cure Disease on yourself while Spirit Tap is still active. The Spirit Decay disease will be gone, but you will have -6 Spirit while Spirit Tap is still active.
5. Wait for Spirit Tap to expire. You should now end up with a permanent -3 Spirit debuff. It can even stack if you do it multiple times.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=1010
         https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=1007

Spell: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=15338
         https://database.turtle-wow.org/?spell=528

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**

Spirit Tap should not double your Spirit debuffs. There should be no permanent attribute loss like this after curing Spirit Decay while Spirit Tap is active.

Thanks for taking the time to read this.

title: BG queues via minimap teleport you back to queue spot upon completion
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
When you queue a BG via the minimap queue, take the pop, complete the game, and leave, you will be teleported back to where you first queued, isntead of where you are in the world.

For UI queueing for dungeons and BGs in WotLK and beyond, this was not the case, you were put right back in place from where the queue actually was popped and taken. This is how people expect it to work.

This back-teleporting is a significant reason that low lv BGs are dead. people don't want to be questing somewhere, get a game, then have to walk all the way back to their questing spot; only sometimes is the back teleport useful, but more often it will be detrimental.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. queue bg via minimap tool
2. move around
3. take bg pop
4. see teleported back to queue spot

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Players should be sent back to the spot they hit "Enter battle" at

title: Taunt should work through banish
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Currently, mobs are immune to taunt when banished.

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Banish an elemental
2. Try to taunt it as druid or war
3. See that it says Immune

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=12076

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
On classic, banished mobs can be tauned (druid and war single and aoe taunts. not mocking blow)

The only time this is important, is when it's really important: the molten core Lava Elementals will do a cone aoe stun, that is nearly always faced towards the casters as healers pull heal threat. If you can taunt before banish ends, this ensures the mob faces away from the raid, and is a way for more attentive tanks to show their skill and strongly help the raid on these pulls. Especially on the 1.12 client, where we don't have accurate banish debuff timers, a team where the warlock coordinates in chat or voice when it's going to break, and the tank that taunts at the right time, should be rewarded. Currently it's just RNG whether all will go well and is more about the tank's internet connection than their attentiveness/execution of the pull.

title: Every non-boss mob in the game uses their abilities far too aggresively
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Most abilities that enemy mobs have, have 0 cooldown (confirmed by lots of priest mind controlling). They also use the abilities at the exact same time, theres no RNG on when they use it. This manifests into buggy, and extremely frustrating encounters all throughout the game, that where multiple mobs either oneshot a dungeon or raid party member or hardcore, or needlessly punish certain classes that cant dispell a mechanic they spam. Here are the most notable, worst offenders:

Every spider, from teldrasil to silithus spiders, will net you almost permanently. 
Similarly blackrock orcs outside UBRS and BWL, and EPL bats, will try to keep slowing poision up almost permanently
Stockades trash mobs, and BFD crabs at the start will keep the tank disarmed for about 50% of the time
Naxx big spiders will cast their poision at the same time, Naxx cursed staves and axes will do their AOE same time, same with faerlina humanoid trash, Gothik trainees and deathknights will do their stun and threat drop at the same time
BWL Taskmasters often like to cast their 1.5k shadowbolt, immediately at the same time. this is 5.5k damage and oneshots anyone thats not a tank, and nearly kills tanks too
MC garr's adds all put the debuff at the same time which absolutely annihilates tanks not in t3, 
UBRS orcs that charge will all charge and stunlock whoever pulls for 3 seconds, so the ideal strat is for a DPS to pull so the tank can actually tank. The summoners at the start and mid of UBRS will also instantly start their summon, and when these are paired with the stunning/knockback mobs, the tank only has a tiny bit of time before they can interrupt the summoner, making these packs far harder than intended.  
Strat guards that spawn after Ramstein the Gordger, all cast their shadowbolts at the same time. Last i remember this does like 5k damage at once? Anyone who doesnt sheild wall this is dead meat, and also dead meat if the dps cant get them down before wall ends. This is very clearly not blizzlike.
BRD baelgar trash mobs will spam their cleaves and others their abilities making this part the hardest dungeon section in the game, even harder than black morass.

These problems are extensive and shouldnt be fixed 1 by 1, there are countless other issues that aren't blizzlike and I forgot about. the entire game, in this regard, needs a blanket rework 

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
On classic, mobs would be rather RNG whether they used their abilities. their abilities all also had long CDs, so when it waaas used, it wouldnt be used again for a while, and instead another ability would be used instead likely.

Currently it seems to be that: 
it's Use Ability, wait 4 seconds, Use same abiltiy, wait 4 seconds
When it should be:
RNG timer, Use Ability, wait 5 seconds, RNG timer, Use different Ability because the first is still on cooldown

The starting mana for a level 1 Tauren Druid should be 67. So 75 > 67, so level 2 gives you more mana. Why is it 97? ≡ƒñú
Something is wrong with the intellect to mana calculation then. Or the way this was fixed.
Base values (int/str/agi for each level) aren't 'calculated' on mangos, those are static values. We're missing a proper source for those sadly.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45871932/155856865-e9bf50dd-7558-46a7-a87b-d7041c8a954a.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45871932/155856891-2b661924-9110-4e7f-8d55-6bbec14781ab.png)
@slowtorta  Season of Mastery level 1 stats
Try these to see if you get the correct mana value.
That won't help me. I need data for every level :( At least the 1 and 60, the rest can be guessed.

Some supplemental information:

This video suggests *total mana* for the first 10 levels (the character does not equip any +int gear during this time)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SJvgNR9EkIk
```
1: 67
2: 75
3: 84
4: 94
5: 119
6: 145
7: 172
8: 185
9: 214
10: 244
```

There is also a page with some good info about the base mana calculation (but ignore the tables- those are for paladins, even though the formulas themselves are identical, the base values differ for that class)

Source (archived):
http://web.archive.org/web/20120127030240/http://orlangur-8eyed.livejournal.com/10931.html?thread=36019

```
How to calculate your health:

Health = Base Health + Health from Stamina + Health from Enchants + Health from Buffs
(Stamina increases your health by 10 for each point of stamina except from first 20 points of stamina that increase your health by 1 each.)

How to calculate your mana:

Mana = Base Mana + Mana from Intellect + Mana from Enchants + Mana from Buffs
(Intellect increases your mana by 15 for each point of intellect except from first 20 points of intellect that increase your mana by 1 each.)
```

Therefore we can assume that a level 1 druid, with 67 mana, and starting 17 intellect, would have a base mana of 50. That correlates with the table here:

https://wowpedia.fandom.com/wiki/Base_mana?oldid=2060777

title: Sunken Temple Avatar of Hakkar Boss Spawn for The God Hakkar quest has issues
body:
**Issues*

1. Should your group wipe, fail, or reset the encounter for whatever reason the second summon will be bugged. There will be no spawns for the 2nd use of the spawn item but the doors will still come down locking you in. A 3rd summon is possible, but buggy

2. Occasionally the encounter seems to bug, and just reset. I believe I've had resets when suppressors were properly handled, and couldn't explain why. I'm not positive, but it seems to be more likely to happen on the third spawn but may also be related to how fast the fires are doused during the first phase of the encounter. It seems like more enemies spawns in general than before on this server, but especially the Hakkari Bloodkeepers that drop the bloods which I suspect could be causing issues.

I don't have a lot of good notes on how this encounter works, since it can be a rather hectic fleeting experience but it does need some investigation. My characters have completed this quest, but if I attempt this encounter again I'll try to record the experience better.

**Expected Behaviour:**

From wowhead comments it sounds like this boss should only be summonable once per instance reset. It might be preferable to being locked in during a 2nd summon with no mobs though the accuracy is questionable.

There should be a delay between Hakkari Bloodkeeper spawns like time or the death of a Nightmare Suppressor. Though, I've seen several bloodkeepers spawn in a very short time sometimes overlapping, but it could be that extra glitchy 3rd summon. I've been wondering if dousing two flames before killing a suppressor is some kind of sequence break that causes the script to reset but haven't had the patience/group to test that.

The wow classic footage shows less adds than I recall during the encounter, but I'll be sure to check back with confirmation of that if I attempt this encounter again. Perhaps with footage, or screenshots.

title: Quest says to shoo sharks but shooing them doesn't work
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
The quest Sharks Are Friends, Not Food says:
>Do you see that dorsal fin rising out of the water? That's a shark. It appears to have come too close to the shoreline which is an anomaly for this species. I'm a marine biologist by trade and I've been watching that poor creature for a while now. There could be a number of reasons that it's trapped here, but the goblins want to kill it like a stuck pig! They think it's a threat to people in the water, but it's probably just scared and confused. I can't let that happen. I need you to go into the water and shoo the shark away. 

1. The shark you must deal with is the one that *does not* have a dorsal fin above the water.  There *are* sharks that have dorsal fins, but they are the baby sharks.  This is misleading.
2. If you go in to the water and shoo sharks with /shoo, nothing happens.
3. The quest goal says "Scare the shark away" but scaring the shark with any fear spell (e.g. Scare Beast) also does not work.

In fact, you must right click sharks deep in the water and talk to them.

**IDs of affected creatures, items, quests or spells with a link to the relevant page:**

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=81006
Quest: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?quest=80383

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
1. If a quest says to shoo a shark, then shooing the shark should work.
2. If a quest says to look for a shark with a dorsal fin above the water, then its dorsal fin should be above the water, especially if *other* sharks *do* have that, and are not the right sharks.
3. If a quest says to scare a shark, then scaring a shark with Scare Beast should work.
4. If a quest requires you to right click a shark, it could say something like "interact with" or "pet" or something that does not misleadingly refer to other abilities like "/shoo" or Scare Beast.

comments.body: Semantically, the healing produced by Judgement of Light on vmangos core belongs to the _paladin_ not the player who activated it like classic. So technically the paladin healed that player hence they get flagged. I think this is the cause of the behavior.

title: Tight leashing/ kiting broken
body:
I have noticed recently that the leashes on most mobs in turtle is incredibly tight, and does not care if the mob has been hit recently. This is a huge problem for classes that need kiting like War or mage, and also triggers on feared mobs very easily. The most obvious way to reproduce this is on a mage using frost nova, blink and frostbolt - leashing will occur within an unreasonably short distance if kiting doesnt back on itself within the same 50 yards. 

I know that its not that the mob isnt being hit enough either as the nova is broken by the frostbolt, and the mob is constantly being hit by frostbolts. I got another lvl 60 mage to test for me and they had the same issue and swore it hadn't been a probelm before, although I cant speak that that personally. Someone is chat said it was about preventing leashing to kill HC chars which I appreciate, but you need to increase it a little IMO

title: Artisan Tailoring can be learned at level 20.
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**

You can train Artisan Tailoring below level 35.  As far as I can tell you only need to be level 20 and have 225 Tailoring.  All other professions require seem to require level 35 and 225 in the skill.  I checked Alchemy, Blacksmithing, Leatherworking and Tailoring on the Horde side.  I have not checked any Alliance side Master Trainers.   This could radically affect the value and prevalence of Mooncloth. If this was done on purpose that's fine.  Devs can have a plan.  It just seems that this is undocumented anywhere.  This shouldn't be a change made without a very good purpose. 


**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Speak to any Master Trainers. 
2. Note what the requirement to train Artisan Skillname
3. Tailoring is Level 20 all other profession seem to be 35.

^this is the blacksmith master trainer

NPC: https://database.turtle-wow.org/?npc=11098

To make mooncloth alts players should have to get to 35 not 20.  This changes the dynamic considerably.  This is fine if Devs have a plan but could have some weird economic outcomes if there isn't a solid plan.

If me and maybe 2 or 3 players being affected by this you can just strip the recipes people.  If 100 people have 3 lvl 20 mooncloth alts that's going to feel worse in the aggregate.

title: [Paladin] Judgement not refreshed by Holy Strike
body:
**Please, provide a clear description what the bug is:**
Paladin's Judgements (Crusader, Light, Wisdom, Justice) are being dropped too frequently, due to that fact that Holy Strike does not refresh the active judgement's duration.

This is exacerbated for retribution paladins, who have 3.6 (circa) weapon speed with only a 10 second window to refresh a judgement. 

**Steps to reproduce the behavior with as much detail as possible:**

1. Judge any seal that leaves a debuff (Crusader, Light, Wisdom, Justice)
2. Stop attacking.
3. Enable Holy Strike with <2 seconds left on judgement.
4. Judgement will fall off.

**Expected behavior. Describe how it should work:**
Adjusting judgement durations or other class remedies would be out of the scope of this bug report.

Holy Strike should just refresh judgements because;
1. It replaces your autoattack, which is the classes only method of extending judgement durations. This causes a bad-taste trade off between gaining an ability, which hinders other parts of the paladin's (limited) toolkit.
2. The tooltip for judgements says "Your melee strikes refresh it's duration". Whilst I realise this tooltip was written before paladins had other strikes, it means this behavior would be within keeping of the mild changes you have made on Turtle.

Thanks for your time.

comments.body: Fixed in 1.16.1.

title: Grammar in quest Kalanar's Mallet
body:
Objective text-
Optional off?: "burnt" most (maybe all?) of this game's quests are written in American English, which would be burned.  Not a huge deal but may as well point it out.
Wrong and Off: "Kalanar Brightshine, from it gather Kalanar's Mallet and return it to him in Astranaar."  Comma splice, either remove the comma after Brightshine or replace it with a period (probably better), and probably replace "from it gather" with something like  "retrieve", setup something like this: "Kalanar Brightshine.  Then retrieve Kalanar's Mallet and..."

Description-
Off: "As the druids tended..." As is unclear here; I initially thought we were going to have a time-based comparison but it was meant as a cause-effect statement.  Maybe replace As with Because for clarity.
Wrong: "tended to The Crescent Grove I" add a comma after Grove
Off: "whatever it was they needed" can drop it was and have the same meaning without sounding dismissive

Wrong: "As of recently a band" put a comma after recently.  As of recently is a verb phrase describing "moved in" at the end of the sentence
Off: "calling themselves the Groveweald" is a verb phrase describing "band of Furbolg", consider moving it immediately next to "band of Furbolg" for sentence flow
Wrong: "In my panic" separate with comma, same reason as before, verb phrase describing why he left stuff behind
Wrong: "treasures, most of it, no doubt burnt to the ground" Period after treasures.  Comma after doubt, was before burnt, consider putting No doubt at the start of the phrase and dropping the comma after most of it.  Also consider burned instead of burnt.  End result: "treasures.  No doubt, most of it was burned to the ground."

Off: "I ask of you" you can drop of here and maintain the same meaning.  Generally prepositional phrases will sound odd when immediately following a verb.
Wrong: "to the Crescent Grove, and to my burnt down home, gather from behind the house my mallet."  Again, consider swapping burnt for burned.  The wrong part is the first two phrases however.  Because his house is in the Crescent Grove, you should just combine the two phrases, like this "to my burned down home in the Crescent Grove" Also the next part is kinda rambling but it can be cleaned up while keeping the spirit of it there (for the sake of the next sentence" by just adjoining the two phrases with an and, overall like this: "to my burned down home in the Crescent Grove and find my mallet behind it."  
Wrong: "It was given to me from my father" from should be by
Off: "and was used to build my house."  Unless somebody else built his house, he should own the action, like "and I used it to build my house."
Wrong: "alot" should be "a lot"

This isn't the only text issue that has claimed to be fixed but isn't (see https://github.com/slowtorta/turtlewow-bug-tracker/issues/872).  Clearly some fixes aren't getting to the players.  I'd like to help you guys improve your bug fix process.  In project I've worked on, issues can only be closed when they've been confirmed to be fixed, usually by a third party.  I suspect you're closing them at the stage of "I did something to fix this".  I know you're not an AAA team (thank goodness) but I'd like to save you from being overwhelmed by regressions.
